sentences.text: NOTICE OF 2017 ANNUAL MEETING OF STOCKHOLDERS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: March 7, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dear Stockholder:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are cordially invited to attend Lennar Corporations 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The meeting will be held on Tuesday, April 18, 2017, at 11:00 a.m. local time at our corporate office, located at 700 Northwest 107th Avenue, Second Floor, Miami, Florida 33172.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the meeting, you will be asked to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Elect ten directors to serve a one-year term expiring at the next Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (2) Ratify the appointment of Deloitte & Touche LLP as our independent registered public accounting firm for our fiscal year ending November 30, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (3) Approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (4) Approve, on an advisory basis, the frequency of the stockholder vote on the compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (5) Vote on a stockholder proposal regarding our common stock voting structure.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will also transact such other business as may properly come before the Annual Meeting and any adjournmen ostponement of the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Only stockholders of record as of the close of business on February 21, 2017 may vote at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is important that your shares be represented at the Annual Meeting, regardless of the number you may hold.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Whether or not you plan to attend, please vote using the Internet, by telephone or by mail, in each case by following the nstructions in our proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This will not prevent you from voting your shares in person if you are present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I look forward to seeing you on April 18, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sincerely,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mark Sustana Secretary and General Counsel
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We mailed a Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials containing instructions on how to access our proxy statement and annual report on or about March 7, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lennars proxy statement and annual report are available online at www.proxyvote.com
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Lennar Corporation 700 Northwest 107th Avenue Miami, Florida 33172
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROXY STATEMENT
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxy Statement for Annual Meeting of Stockholders to be held on April 18, 2017
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You are receiving this proxy statement because you own shares of our Class A common stock and/or Class B common stock that entitle you to vote at the 2017 Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors is soliciting proxies from stockholders who wish to vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By use of a proxy, you can vote even if you do not attend the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proxy statement describes the matters on which you are being asked to vote and provides information on those matters so that you can make an informed decision.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Date, Time and Place of the 2017 Annual Meeting
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will hold the 2017 Annual Meeting on Tuesday, April 18, 2017, at 11:00 a.m. local time at our corporate office located at 700 Northwest 107th Avenue, Second Floor, Miami, Florida 33172.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: uestions and Answers about Voting at the Annual Meeting and Related Matter
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: How many votes may I cast at the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: You may vote all of the shares of our Class A common stock and Class B common stock that you owned at the close of business on February 21, 2017, the record date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may cast one vote for each share of our Class A common stock held by you on all matters presented at the meeting, and ten votes for each share of our Class B common stock held by you on all matters presented at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On the record date, 203,160,520 shares of our Class A common stock and 31,303,195 shares of our Class B common stock were outstanding and entitled to be voted at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: What constitutes a quorum, and why is a quorum required?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: We are required to have a quorum of stockholders present to conduct business at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A majority in voting power, and not less than one-third in number, of the shares of Class A common stock and Class B common stock entitled to vote, represented in person or by proxy, will constitute a quorum for the transaction of business at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proxies received but marked as abstentions, if any, will be included in the calculation of the number of shares considered to be present at the meeting for quorum purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If we do not have a quorum, we will be forced to reconvene the Annual Meeting at a later date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: What is the difference between a stockholder of record and a beneficial owner?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: If your shares are registered directly in your name with Lennars transfer agent, Computershare Trust Company, N.A., you are considered, with respect to those shares, the stockholder of record.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held by a brokerage firm, bank, trustee or other agent (nominee), you are considered the beneficial owner of these shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held by a nominee, the Notice of Internet Availability of Proxy Materials (Notice of Internet Availability) was forwarded to you by your nominee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As the beneficial owner, you have the right to direct your nominee on how to vote your shares by following your nominees instructions for voting by telephone or on the Internet or, if you specifically request a copy of the printed materials, you may use the voting instruction card included in the materials you receive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: How do I vote?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: If you are a stockholder of record, you may vote:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: via Internet;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: by telephone;   by mail, if you have received a paper copy of the proxy materials; or   in person at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Detailed instructions for Internet and telephone voting are set forth on the Notice of Internet Availability, which also contains instructions on how to access our proxy statement and annual report online.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may also vote in person at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial owner, you must follow the voting procedures of your nominee included with your proxy materials.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If your shares are held by a nominee and you intend to vote at the meeting, please bring with you evidence of your beneficial ownership as of the record date (such as a letter from your nominee confirming your beneficial ownership or a bank or brokerage firm account statement).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: f your shares are held in our 401(k) plan, your proxy will serve as a voting instruction for the trustee of our 401(k) plan, who will vote your shares as you instruct.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To allow sufficient time for the trustee to vote, your voting nstructions must be received by April 16, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the trustee does not receive your instructions by that date, the rustee will vote the shares you hold through our 401(k) plan in the same proportion as it votes the shares in our 401(k) plan for which voting instructions are received.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: What am I voting on?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: At the Annual Meeting you will be asked to vote on the following five proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board recommendation for each of these proposals is set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal      Board Recommendation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1.     To elect ten directors to serve a one-year term expiring at the next Annual Meeting of Stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR all nominees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.     To ratify the appointment of Deloitte & Touche LLP (D&T) as our independent registered public accounting firm for our fiscal year ending November 30, 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3.     To approve, on an advisory basis, the compensation of our named executive officers, which we refer to as Say on Pay.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4.     To approve, on an advisory basis, the frequency of the stockholder vote on the compensation of our named executive officers, which we refer to as Say on Frequency.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: FOR
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5.     To vote on a stockholder proposal regarding our common stock voting structure (Give Each Share an Equal Vote).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: AGAINST
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We will also consider any other business that may come before the meeting in a manner that is proper under Delaware law and our By-Laws.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: What happens if additional matters are presented at the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: Other than the items of business described in this proxy statement, we are not aware of any business to be presented for action at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you grant a proxy, the persons named as proxy holders, Stuart Miller, Bruce Gross and Mark Sustana, or any of them, will be able to vote your shares in their discretion on any additional matters that are properly presented for a vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: What is the required vote for approval of each of the proposals?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: Below is the required vote for approval of each of the proposals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal      Votes Required for Approval
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1.     Election of Directors      Plurality of the votes cast
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.     Ratification of Auditors      Majority of votes cast
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3.     Say on Pay      Majority of votes cast
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4.     Say on Frequency      Majority of votes cast
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5.     Give Each Share an Equal Vote      Majority of votes cast
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With regard to each proposal, holders of shares of our Class A common stock and Class B common stock vote together as a single class (but with different voting rights).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A proposal has received a majority of the votes cast if the votes cast FOR the proposal exceed the votes cast AGAINST the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposals 3 and 4 are advisory votes, which means that while we ask stockholders to approve resolutions regarding the compensation of our named executive officers and the frequency of the vote regarding the compensation of our named executive officers, the results of those votes will not have a binding effect on us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although the advisory votes are non-binding, our Board and the Compensation Committee will review the results of the votes and take them into account in making future determinations concerning executive compensation and the frequency of the vote regarding executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 5 is a precatory proposal, which means that it is requesting our Board take steps to ensure that all of our companys outstanding stock has one vote per share in each voting situation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: An affirmative vote will not, by itself, result in the change that is requested.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: What if I sign and return my proxy without making any selections?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: If you sign and return your proxy without making any selections, your shares will be voted FOR all of the director nominees, FOR proposals 2, 3 and 4, and AGAINST proposal 5.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If other matters properly come before the Annual Meeting, Stuart Miller, Bruce Gross and Mark Sustana, or any of them, will have the authority to vote your shares on those matters at their discretion.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As of the date of this proxy statement, we are not aware of any matters that will come before the meeting other than those described in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: What if I am a beneficial owner and I do not give my nominee voting instructions?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: If you are a beneficial owner and your shares are held in the name of a broker, the broker is bound by the rules of the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) regarding whether or not it can exercise discretionary voting power for any particular proposal if the broker does not receive voting instructions from you.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Brokers have the authority to vote shares for which their customers do not provide voting instructions on certain routine matters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A broker non-vote occurs when a nominee who holds shares for a beneficial owner does not vote the beneficial owners shares on a particular item because the nominee does not have discretionary voting authority for that item and has not received instructions from the beneficial owner.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Broker non-votes are included in the calculation of the number of votes
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: considered to be present at the meeting for purposes of determining the presence of a quorum but are not counted as votes cast with respect to a matter on which the nominee has expressly not voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The table below sets forth, for each proposal on the ballot, whether a broker can exercise discretion and vote shares absent instructions from the beneficial owner and, if not, the impact of broker non-votes on the approval of the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal    Can Brokers Vote Absent Instructions?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Impact of Broker Non-Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 1.     Election of Directors    No    None
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2.     Ratification of Auditors    Yes    Not Applicable
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 3.     Say on Pay    No    None
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 4.     Say on Frequency    No    None
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 5.     Give Each Share an Equal Vote    No    None
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: What if I abstain on a proposal?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: If you sign and return your proxy or voting instruction marked abstain with regard to any proposal, your shares will not be voted on that proposal and will not be counted as votes cast in the final tally of votes with regard to that proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, your shares will be counted for purposes of determining whether a quorum is present.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Can I change my vote after I have delivered my proxy?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: Yes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You may revoke your proxy at any time before the shares are voted.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a record owner, you will automatically revoke your proxy with regard to a matter by voting in person with regard to that matter at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you are a beneficial owner, you must contact your nominee to change your vote or obtain a proxy to vote your shares in person at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Who can attend the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: Only stockholders and our invited guests can attend the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To gain admittance, you must bring a form of government issued personal identification to the meeting, where your name will be verified against our stockholder list.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a broker or other nominee holds your shares and you plan to attend the meeting, you should bring a recent brokerage statement showing your ownership of the shares as of the record date or a letter from the broker confirming your ownership, and a form of government issued personal identification.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: If I plan to attend the Annual Meeting, should I still vote by proxy?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: Yes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Casting your vote in advance does not affect your right to attend the Annual Meeting or to vote at the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If you vote in advance and also attend the meeting, you do not need to vote again at the meeting unless you want to change your vote with regard to a matter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Written ballots will be available at the meeting for stockholders of record and for beneficial owners who have proxies from their nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beneficial stockholders who wish to vote in person must request a legal proxy from the broker or other nominee and bring that legal proxy to the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Where can I find the voting results of the Annual Meeting?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: We will announce the results for the proposals voted upon at the Annual Meeting and publish final detailed voting results in a Form 8-K that we will file with the SEC within four business days after the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Q: Who should I call with questions?
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A: If you have questions about this proxy statement or the Annual Meeting or would like additional copies of this proxy statement or our annual report, please contact: Lennar Corporation, 700 Northwest 107th Avenue, Miami, Florida 33172, Attention: Investor Relations, Telephone: (305) 485-2038.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: I. PROPOSAL 1  ELECTION OF DIRECTORS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors is responsible for overseeing the management of our business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We keep directors informed of our business at meetings and through reports and analyses presented to the Board of Directors or to committees of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Regular communications between the directors and management also occur apart from meetings of the Board of Directors and committees of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Among other things, from time to time, the Board schedules calls with senior management to discuss the Companys business strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our By-Laws, directors are elected at each annual meeting of stockholders for a one-year term expiring at the next annual meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon the recommendation of the Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee (the NCG Committee), our Board has nominated Mr. Irving Bolotin, Mr. Steven L. Gerard, Mr. Theron I. (Tig) Gilliam, Mr. Sherrill W. Hudson, Mr. Sidney Lapidus, Ms. Teri P. McClure, Mr. Stuart Miller, Mr. Armando Olivera, Dr. Donna Shalala and Mr. Jeffrey Sonnenfeld for re-election, each for a one-year term that will expire at the 2018 annual meeting of stockholders, and each has consented to serve if elected.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that each of our directors possesses the experience, skills and qualities to fully perform his or her duties as a director and contribute to our success.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our directors were nominated because each possesses outstanding personal integrity and interpersonal and communication skills, is highly accomplished in his or her field, has an understanding of the interests and issues that are important to our stockholders and is able to dedicate sufficient time to fulfilling his or her obligations as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our directors as a group complement each other and each others respective experiences, skills and qualities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each directors principal occupation and other pertinent information about particular experience, qualifications, attributes and skills that led the Board to conclude that each nominee should serve as a director, appears on the following pages.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Irving Bolotin, 84, has served as a director of our Company since 1974.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bolotin is currently retired.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1972 until his retirement in December 1998, Mr. Bolotin served as a Senior Vice President of our Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Bolotin also serves with the Board of Directors of WPBT Channel 2.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Qualifications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board nominated Mr. Bolotin to serve as a director because of the extensive knowledge of homebuilding he obtained during the many years he was a member of our senior management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Steven L. Gerard, 71, has served as a director of our Company since May 2000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gerard has been the Chairman of CBIZ, Inc., a provider of professional business services to individuals and companies throughout the United States, since October 2002.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gerard was appointed Chief Executive Officer and Director of CBIZ, Inc. in October 2000, and served as its CEO until his retirement in March 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From July 1997 to October 2000, Mr. Gerard served as Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Great Point Capital, Inc., an operations and financial consulting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From September 1992 to July 1997, Mr. Gerard served as Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of Triangle Wire & Cable, Inc., and its successor, Ocean View Capital, Inc., a manufacturer of residential, commercial and industrial wire and cable products.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to that, Mr. Gerard spent sixteen years in various corporate finance and banking positions at Citibank, N.A. and spent seven years at the American Stock Exchange, last serving as Vice President of its Securities Division.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gerard also serves on the Board of Directors of Joy Global, Inc. and Las Vegas Sands Corp.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Qualifications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board nominated Mr. Gerard to serve as a director because of his experience as the Chief Executive Officer and in other senior management positions of significant companies for many years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Tig Gilliam, 52, has served as a director of our Company since June 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gilliam has served as Chief Executive Officer of NES Global Talent, a global talent solutions company, since November 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gilliam was previously a Managing Director and Operating Partner of AEA Investors LP, a private equity firm, from
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: November 2013 to November 2014 and the Regional Head of North America and former member of the Executive Committee at Addeco Group SA, a human resources, temporary staffing and recruiting firm, from March 2007 until July 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 2002 until he joined Addeco, Mr. Gilliam was with International Business Machines (IBM), serving, among other things, as the Global Supply Chain Management Leader for IBM Global Business Services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gilliam was a partner with PricewaterhouseCoopers Consulting until it was acquired by IBM in October 2002.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Gilliam also serves on the Board of Directors of GMS, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Qualifications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board nominated Mr. Gilliam to serve as a director because of his expertise in matters related to supply chain management and human resources.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sherrill W. Hudson, 74, has served as a director of our Company since January 2008.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hudson has served as the Chairman of TECO Energy, Inc., an energy-related holding company, since January 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Previously, Mr. Hudson was Executive Chairman of TECO Energy from August 2010 to December 2012, and Chairman and Chief Executive Officer of TECO Energy from 2004 until August 2010.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining TECO Energy in July 2004, Mr. Hudson spent 37 years with Deloitte & Touche LLP until he retired in 2002.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hudson is a member of the Florida Institute of Certified Public Accountants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Hudson serves on the Boards of Directors of CBIZ, Inc. and United Insurance Holdings Corp, and, from 2003 until April 2015, served on the Board of Directors of Publix Supermarkets, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: He is also Chairman of the Florida Chapter of the National Association of Corporate Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Qualifications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board nominated Mr. Hudson to serve as a director because of his extensive knowledge of accounting and his management experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Sidney Lapidus, 79, has served as a director of our Company since April 1997, and has served as our Lead Director since 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lapidus is a retired partner of Warburg Pincus LLC, a private equity investment firm, where he was employed from 1967 until his retirement in 2007.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lapidus also serves on the Board of Directors of Knoll, Inc., as well as a number of non-profit organizations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Qualifications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board nominated Mr. Lapidus to serve as a director because of the extensive knowledge of business enterprises (including homebuilding companies) and corporate governance he gained as a partner in a private equity investment firm and as a director of a number of publicly and privately owned companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Teri P. McClure, 53, has served as a director of our Company since June 2013.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. McClure is currently Chief Human Resources Officer and Senior Vice President Labor and Communications of UPS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: She also serves as a member of the nine member Management Committee which is responsible for setting strategy, operating and profit plans for UPS.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ms. McClure joined UPS in 1995 and has served in various positions at the company including Chief Legal Officer, Senior Vice President of Compliance and Public Affairs, General Counsel and Corporate Secretary from 2006 to December 2015, when she assumed her current position.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Prior to joining UPS, Ms. McClure practiced with the Troutman Sanders law firm in Atlanta.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Qualifications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board nominated Ms. McClure to serve as a director because of her experience as a senior executive of a Fortune 500 company, her operational capabilities and her business experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stuart Miller, 59, has served as a director of our Company since April 1990 and has served as our Chief Executive Office since April 1997.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Miller also served as President of our Company from April 1997 to April 2011.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, Mr. Miller serves on the Board of Directors of Five Point Holdings, LLC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Qualifications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board nominated Mr. Miller to serve as a director because he is our Chief Executive Officer and has extensive knowledge of our Company, its operations and its strategic plans.

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: electric utilities in the United States, from June 2003, and Chief Executive Officer from July 2008, until his retirement in May 2012.

sentences.text: Prior to his 2003 appointment as President, Mr. Olivera served in a variety of management positions with the company, including Vice President of Construction Services, System Operations and Distribution and Senior Vice President of System Operations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Olivera also serves on the Board of Directors of Consolidated Edison, Inc. and Fluor Corporation, and previously served on the Board of Directors of AGL Resources, Inc., Florida Power & Light Company and Nicor Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board nominated Mr. Olivera to serve as a director because of his experience and understanding of operations and finance as well as his strong business leadership skills.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Donna Shalala, 76, has served as a director of our company since January 2017, and previously served as a director of our company from 2001 to 2012.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since June 2001, Dr. Shalala has served as Trustee Professor of Political Science at the University of Miami, and since 2015, Dr. Shalala has served as President of the Clinton Foundation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Shalala served as President of the University of Miami from 2001 to 2015.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1993 to 2001, Dr. Shalala served as the United States Secretary of Health and Human Services.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Shalala served as Chancellor and Professor of Political Science at the University of Wisconsin  Madison from 1987 to 1993 and as President and Professor of Political Science at Hunter College from 1980 to 1987.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: From 1977 to 1980, Dr. Shalala served as Assistant Secretary for Policy Development and Research of the Department of Housing and Urban Development.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Dr. Shalala also serves on the Board of Directors of MEDNAX, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Qualifications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board nominated Dr. Shalala to serve as a director because of her experience as President of a successful university, her experience as the former Secretary of the United States Department of Health and Human Services and her leadership skills.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jeffrey Sonnenfeld, 62, has served as a director of our Company since September 2005.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Sonnenfeld has served as the Senior Associate Dean for Executive Programs and the Lester Crown Professor-in-the-Practice of Management at the Yale School of Management since 2001.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 1989, Mr. Sonnenfeld founded the Chief Executive Leadership Institute of Yale University, and he has served as its President since that time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Qualifications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board nominated Mr. Sonnenfeld to serve as a director because of his business acumen and experience, as well as his exceptional work in the areas of corporate governance and leadership development as President of the Chief Executive Leadership Institute of Yale University.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote FOR all the director nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: II.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CORPORATE GOVERNANCE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Meetings
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors normally meets quarterly, but holds additional meetings as required.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under our Corporate Governance Guidelines, each director is required to attend substantially all meetings of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal 2016, the Board of Directors met six times.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During that year, each director attended at least 75% of (1) the total number of meetings of the Board of Directors held while that director was serving on our Board, and (2) the total number of meetings of each committee of the Board on which the director was serving.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It is our policy to encourage directors and nominees for election as directors to attend the annual meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All members of our Board who were serving at the time of the 2016 annual meeting of stockholders attended the meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Independence
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each year, the Board undertakes a review of director independence, which includes a review of each directors responses to questionnaires asking about any relationships with us.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In January 2017, our Board of Directors undertook its review of director independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on this review, our Board of Directors has determined that each of Mr. Bolotin, Mr. Gerard, Mr. Gilliam, Mr. Hudson, Mr. Lapidus, Ms. McClure, Mr. Olivera and Mr. Sonnenfeld is independent under the NYSE corporate governance listing standards and the Director Qualification Standards set forth in our Corporate Governance Guidelines, which are consistent with the NYSE standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: After considering any relevant transactions or relationships between each director, or any of his or her family members, and the Company, our senior management or our independent registered public accounting firm, the Board of Directors has affirmatively determined that none of the independent directors has a material relationship with us (either directly, or as a partner, significant stockholder, officer or affiliate of an organization that has a material relationship with us), other than as a member of our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In determining whether Mr. Gilliam is independent, the Board viewed Mr. Gilliams position as a director of a company that supplies wallboard to Lennar as not impairing his independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board also considered that NES Global Talent, where Mr. Gilliam is Chief Executive Officer, and Generation Brands, from which Lennar purchases lighting products, are both subsidiaries of AEA Investors LP, but did not view these relationships as impairing Mr. Gilliams independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lapidus serves as our Lead Director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In this capacity, Mr. Lapidus presides over Board meetings and presides at all meetings of our independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with our regularly scheduled Board meetings, our independent directors regularly meet in executive sessions that exclude our non-independent director and management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Lapidus presides over these executive sessions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Leadership Structure
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a Lead Director who presides over Board meetings and presides at all meetings of our independent directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board believes that arrangement works well for us because all but two of our directors (our Chief Executive Officer and Dr. Shalala, for whom independence as a director has not been determined yet) are independent, and our Lead Director can cause the independent directors to meet at any time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the Lead Director can at any time bring to the attention of a majority of the directors any matters he thinks should be addressed by the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Lead Directors duties, which are listed in our By-Laws, include:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Presiding at all meetings of the independent directors;   Presiding over, and being responsible for the agenda at, all meetings of the Board of Directors, if there is no Chairman of the Board, and, at the request of the Board of Directors, presiding over meetings of stockholders;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Conveying recommendations of the independent directors to the Board of Directors; and   Serving as a liaison between the Board and management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Committees
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board has four standing Committees: the Audit Committee, the Compensation Committee, the NCG Committee and the Executive Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A summary of the current composition of each Committee and its responsibilities is set forth below.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Name      Audit       Compensation       Nominating and   Corporate Governance      Executive  Irving Bolotin    Member       Member     Steven L. Gerard    Member   Chair         Tig Gilliam    Member   Member    Member     Sherrill Hudson    Chair    Member         Sidney Lapidus(1)                Member Teri P. McClure        Member    Member     Stuart Miller                Member Armando Olivera    Member            Donna Shalala                 Jeffrey Sonnenfeld            Chair
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (1) Lead Director of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Copies of the Committee charters of each of the Audit Committee, the Compensation Committee and the NCG Committee setting forth the responsibilities of the Committees can be found under the Investor Relations-Corporate Governance section of our website at www.lennar.com, and those charters are also available in print to any stockholder who requests them through our Investor Relations department.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We periodically review and revise the Committee charters.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board most recently adopted a revised Audit Committee Charter and NCG Committee Charter on June 23, 2015 and a revised Compensation Committee Charter on October 31, 2014.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Number of Meetings in fiscal 2016: 11
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee is responsible for selecting our independent auditors and overseeing the engagement of our independent auditors; pre-approving all audit and non-audit services provided to us by our independent auditors; reviewing our internal control environment, systems and performance; and overseeing the integrity of our financial statements, and our compliance with legal and regulatory requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee also discusses and reviews our policies with respect to risk assessment and risk management, including guidelines and policies governing our risk assessment and risk management processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee Chairman reports on Audit Committee actions and recommendations at Board of Directors meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independence and Financial Expertise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has determined that each member of the Audit Committee meets the independence requirements under the NYSEs corporate governance listing standards and the enhanced independence standards for audit committee members required by the SEC, and each member is financially literate, knowledgeable and qualified to review financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Board of Directors has determined that each of Mr. Gerard, Mr. Gilliam and Mr. Hudson meets the requirements of an audit committee financial expert under SEC rules.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Number of Meetings in fiscal 2016: 4
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee is responsible for
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) designing our executive compensation philosophy, policies and plans,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) establishing salaries, targets and performance goals for annual incentive awards, terms of equity awards and other forms of compensation for our Chief Executive Officer (CEO), each of our senior executives and our directors and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) administering our equity programs, including awards under our 2007 Equity Incentive Plan, as amended (the 2007 Equity Plan), and 2016 Equity Incentive Plan (the 2016 Equity Plan).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 Equity Plan replaced our prior equity plan, the 2007 Equity Plan, in fiscal 2016.The Compensation Committee also reviews the results of the annual advisory stockholder vote on executive compensation and considers whether to recommend adjustments to the Companys executive compensation policies and plans as a result of such votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Compensation Committee establishes performance goals and certifies that the performance goals have been attained for purposes of Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code, as amended.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee Chairman reports on Compensation Committee actions and recommendations at Board of Directors meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has determined that each member of the Compensation Committee meets the independence requirements under the NYSEs corporate governance listing standards, is an outside director pursuant to the criteria established by the Internal Revenue Service and meets the independence standards for Compensation Committee members established by the SEC.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Compensation Consultants and Advisors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has the authority, pursuant to its charter, to engage the services of outside legal or other experts and advisors as it deems necessary and appropriate to assist the Compensation Committee in fulfilling its duties and responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has previously engaged, and may in the future engage, F.W. Cook & Co., Inc. (FW Cook), an independent management compensation consulting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal 2016, the Compensation Committee engaged F.W. Cook to perform a review of the Companys non-employee director compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considered the work previously performed by FW Cook and determined that no conflicts of interest were raised and that FW Cook was independent from management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Management and Delegation of Authority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As more fully discussed under Compensation Discussion and Analysis  Compensation Setting Process  Role of Management, our CEO and our President provide the Compensation Committee with (1) evaluations of each named executive officer, including themselves, (2) recommendations regarding base salary levels for the upcoming year for each named executive officer, other than themselves, (3) an evaluation of the extent to which each named executive officer met his annual incentive plan target, and (4) recommendations regarding the aggregate value of the long-term incentive compensation that each named executive officer should receive.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO and our President typically attend all regularly-scheduled Compensation Committee meetings to assist the Compensation Committee in its discussion and analysis of the various agenda items, and are generally excused from the meetings as appropriate, including for discussions regarding their own compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under the 2007 Equity Plan and the 2016 Equity Plan, the Compensation Committee has the authority to delegate all or a part of its duties with respect to awards under each plan to management (excluding awards intended to qualify as performance-based compensation under Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code, awards made to individuals covered by Section 16 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (the Exchange Act), and awards issued to any person delegated authority by the Compensation Committee).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under both the Lennar Corporation 2012 Incentive Compensation Plan and the Lennar Corporation 2016 Incentive Compensation Plan, the Compensation Committee has the authority to delegate all or a part of its duties with respect to bonuses under the plan to management (excluding bonuses intended to qualify as performance-based compensation under Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nominating and Corporate Governance Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Number of Meetings in fiscal 2016: 4
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Responsibilities.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NCG Committee is responsible for
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) soliciting, considering, recommending and nominating candidates to serve on the Board under criteria adopted by it from time to time;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) advising the Board with respect to Board and Committee composition;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) reviewing and recommending changes to our Corporate Governance Guidelines;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) overseeing periodic evaluations of the Board and the Committees; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) reviewing and reporting to the Board on a periodic basis with regard to matters of corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NCG Committee Chairman reports on NCG Committee actions and recommendations at Board of Director meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors has determined that each member of the NCG Committee meets the independence requirements under the NYSEs corporate governance listing standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consideration of Director Nominees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NCG Committee considers possible candidates for nomination as directors suggested by management and by stockholders and others, if there were any.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NCG Committee would evaluate the suitability of any potential candidates recommended by stockholders in the same manner as other candidates recommended to the NCG Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NCG Committee and the Board of Directors have determined that a director should have the following characteristics, as set forth in our Corporate Governance Guidelines:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Ability to comprehend the strategic goals of the Company and to help guide the Company towards the accomplishment of those goals;   A history of conducting his/her personal and professional affairs with the utmost integrity and observing
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: throughout the Company;   Knowledge of, and experience with regard to at least some of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) real estate properties, loans and securities, including any lending and financing activities related thereto;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) public company regulations imposed by the SEC and the NYSE, among others;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) portfolio and risk management;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) the major geographic locations within which the Company operates;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) sound business practices and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) accounting and financial reporting; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: and  If applicable, ability to satisfy the criteria for independence established by the SEC and the NYSE, as they may be amended from time to time.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While our NCG Committee believes diversity as to race, gender and ethnicity is beneficial to the Board of Directors, and takes that into account in considering potential Board members, the NCG Committee does not have a formal policy regarding Board diversity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NCG Committee will consider candidates recommended by stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a stockholder wishes to recommend a potential nominee for director, the stockholder should submit a recommendation in writing containing the nformation set forth below to the NCG Committee at the address set forth on page 50 under Communication with Lennars Board of Directors:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The recommending stockholders name and contact information;   The candidates name and contact information;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The candidates name and contact information;  A brief description of the candidates background and qualifications
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The reasons why the recommending stockholder believes the candidate would be well suited for the Board;  A written statement by the candidate that the candidate is willing and able to serve on the Board;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: the Board; and   A brief description of the recommending stockholders ownership of our common stock and the period during which such shares have been held.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In making its determination whether to recommend that the Board of Directors nominate a candidate who has been recommended by a stockholder, the NCG Committee will consider, among other things, the appropriateness of adding another director to the Board and the candidates background and qualifications.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NCG Committee may conduct an independent investigation of the background and qualifications of a candidate recommended by a stockholder, and may request an interview with the candidate.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The NCG Committee will not determine whether to recommend that the Board nominate a candidate until the NCG Committee completes what it believes to be a reasonable investigation, even if that causes its recommendation to be delayed until after it is too late for the candidate to be nominated for election at a particular meeting of stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When the NCG Committee determines not to recommend that the Board nominate a candidate recommended by a stockholder, or the Board determines to nominate or not to nominate a candidate recommended by a stockholder, the NCG Committee will notify the recommending stockholder and the candidate of the determination.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to our By-Laws, our Board of Directors has established an Executive Committee which has the authority to act on behalf of the Board of Directors, except as that power is limited by the corporate laws of the State of Delaware, where our Company is incorporated, and as our Board of Directors has otherwise provided.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Executive Committee took action by unanimous written consent twice during fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Corporate Governance Guidelines
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines describe our corporate governance practices and policies and provide a framework for our Board governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The topics addressed in our Corporate Governance Guidelines include director qualifications, director responsibilities, management succession, director compensation and the annual performance evaluation of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Corporate Governance Guidelines are available to view at our website, www.lennar.com, under the Investor Relations-Corporate Governance section.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Committee Interlocks and Insider Participation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: None of the members who served on the Compensation Committee during the fiscal year ended November 30, 2016, was, or ever had been, an officer or employee of Lennar.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: There were no transactions during the 2016 fiscal year between us and any of the directors who served as members of the Compensation Committee for any part of the 2016 fiscal year that would require disclosure by Lennar under the SECs rules requiring disclosure of certain relationships and related-party transactions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Code of Business Conduct and Ethics/Related Party Transaction Policy
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors has adopted a Code of Business Conduct and Ethics applicable to all our directors, officers and employees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Its purpose is to promote our commitment to high standards for ethical business practices.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Code provides that it is our policy that our business be conducted with the highest level of integrity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: It states that our reputation for integrity is one of our most valuable assets, and each director, officer and employee is expected to contribute to the care and preservation of that asset.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Code addresses a number of issues, including conflicts of interest, corporate opportunities, fair dealing, confidential information and insider trading.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to our Audit Committee Charter, all related person transactions as defined by SEC rules must be approved by our Audit Committee.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Current SEC rules require disclosure of any transaction, arrangement or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: relationship in which
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) Lennar or its subsidiary is a participant,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the amount involved exceeds $120,000, and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) any executive officer, director, director nominee, beneficial owner of more than 5% of Lennars common stock, or any immediate family member of any such persons has or will have a direct or indirect material interest.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All directors must recuse themselves from any discussion or decision affecting their personal, business or professional interests.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Certain Relationships and Related Transactions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Except as described below, since December 1, 2015, we have not had any relationships or transactions with any of our executive officers, directors, beneficial owners of more than 5% of our Class A common stock or Class B common stock or any immediate family member of such persons that are required to be described pursuant to Item 404(a) of SEC Regulation S-K.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2015, Stuart Miller, our CEO, entered into a Time-Sharing Agreement with one of our subsidiaries, which replaced a prior agreement and provides that Mr. Miller can sub-lease aircraft leased by that subsidiary for non-business or personal business purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under that Agreement, Mr. Miller pays the subsidiary, out of a prepayment fund established under the terms of the agreement, the aggregate incremental cost of each flight based on a list of expenses authorized by federal regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The subsidiary retains sole discretion to determine what flights may be scheduled by Mr. Miller, and under the Agreement the Companys prior planned use of the aircraft takes precedence over Mr. Millers non-business or personal business use.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Miller paid our subsidiary $357,000 under the agreement for his use of the aircraft during fiscal 2016 (the cost reimbursed by Mr. Miller was calculated in accordance with Federal Aviation Administration regulations).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In February 2015, Rick Beckwitt, our President, entered into a Time-Sharing Agreement with one of our subsidiaries, which replaced a prior agreement and provides that Mr. Beckwitt can sub-lease aircraft leased by that subsidiary for non-business or personal business purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The terms of that Time-Sharing Agreement are essentially the same as those in the Time-Sharing Agreement between the subsidiary and Mr. Miller, including the establishment of a prepayment fund for the cost of each flight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Beckwitt paid our subsidiary $72,000 under the agreement for his use of the aircraft during fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Occasionally, a spouse or other guest may accompany Mr. Miller or Mr. Beckwitt when they are using corporate aircraft for business travel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As there is no incremental cost to Lennar for the spouse or other guest accompanying the executive on a flight, no amount has been included in the Summary Compensation Table with respect to that usage.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Because there are special tax rules regarding personal use of business aircraft, Mr. Miller or Mr. Beckwitt may be treated as receiving taxable income when a spouse or guest accompanies one of them on a business trip.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We lease charter aircraft from time to time for business-related travel for Jonathan M. Jaffe, our Chief Operating Officer (COO).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We also permit leased aircraft to be available for personal use by Mr. Jaffe, for which he pays the Company, out of a prepayment fund established in connection with the arrangement, an amount equal to twice the cost of fuel for each flight.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fiscal 2016, Mr. Jaffe paid the Company $177,000 for his personal use of charter aircraft.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In June 2015, Jeffrey Miller, Stuart Millers brother, entered into an agreement with one of our subsidiaries which provides that Jeffrey Miller can sub-lease an aircraft leased by that subsidiary for personal purposes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Company retains sole discretion to determine what flights may be scheduled, and the Companys prior planned use of the aircraft takes precedence over Jeffrey Millers use.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jeffrey Miller pays for use of the aircraft based on a fee structure similar to that used by third party charter companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Jeffrey Miller paid our subsidiary $298,000 under the agreement for his use of the aircraft during fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The arrangement helps to offset the cost of the aircraft when it is not being used by the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Risk Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Board Role in Management of Risk
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board is actively involved in the oversight and management of risks that could affect Lennar.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management, in consultation with the Board, identifies areas of risk that particularly affect us and assigns senior members of our management to report to the Board on each of those areas of risk on a rotating basis at the regularly scheduled quarterly Board meetings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The areas of risk reported to the Board change from time to time based on business conditions, advice of outside advisors, and review of risks identified by our competitors in their public filings.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Currently, the risk areas reported on to our Board on a regular basis relate to joint ventures, housing inventory and land supply, construction costs, quality and warranty, financial services, associate retention and human resources, legal, natural disasters and information technology, including cybersecurity, taxation, strategic investments, Rialtos business, our multifamily business and our solar business.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board of Directors also asks for and receives reports on other risks that affect the Company after review of business presentations made during regular Board reviews.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, one of the responsibilities of our Audit Committee is to discuss and review policies with respect to risk assessment and risk management, including guidelines and policies governing our risk assessment and risk management processes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Related Risks
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In early 2017, as part of our risk management process, we conducted a comprehensive review and evaluation of our compensation programs and policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The assessment covered each material component of executive and non-executive employee compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In evaluating our compensation components, we identified the following risk- limiting characteristics:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: may impact compensation, are reviewed by at least one independent member of our Board of Directors.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The payment of cash bonuses to our senior executives and other members of our senior management are based upon achievement of performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While a potentially substantial amount of the compensation of our CEO, our President and our COO is tied to short-term Company performance, it is balanced by the compensation of our Chief Financial Officer (CFO) and our General Counsel, whose bonus targets are based on, among other factors, the performance of the Company in its adherence to corporate governance, policies and procedures and the results of an annual internal audit evaluation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: manages must be approved by our senior corporate management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A high percentage of our overall pay mix to senior management and key employees is equity based, which incentivizes efforts to generate long-term appreciation of stockholder value.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity awards to our executive officers vest over a three-year period, which mitigates against focusing on
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: short-term returns.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Stock Ownership Guidelines require executive officers to hold any vested restricted stock until the aggregate amount of their stock ownership exceeds a multiple of their annual base salary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Director Compensation
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: General.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board maintains a compensation program for the non-employee directors of the Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal 2016, the Board, with the assistance of FW Cook, performed a review of the Companys non-employee director compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the review, it was determined that the Companys total compensation per director is positioned between the 25th percentile and the median, while the Company
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: is above the 75th percentile in size relative to peer companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board reviewed data compiled by FW Cook from large companies (revenues between $2.5 billion and $10 billion) as well as the top 200 largest companies in the S&P 500.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, effective April 13, 2016, the non-employee director compensation program was revised to increase the annual directors fee from $90,000 to $130,000.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, based on the broader market move away from granting stock options in favor of full-value shares, the program was revised to eliminate the annual grant of options to purchase 2,500 shares of our Class A common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Below is a full description of the non-employee director compensation plan under which the Board was compensated in fiscal 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Equity Grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the time of each annual meeting, each non-employee director receives a grant of 2,000 shares of our Class A common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors are permitted to sell 50% of that stock at any time but are required to hold the remaining 50% of the stock until the second anniversary of the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Pursuant to this program, on April 13, 2016, each non-employee director at that time was granted 2,000 shares of Class A common stock, 50% of which may not be transferred until the second anniversary of the date of grant.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Retainer and Committee Fees Paid in Cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each non-employee director is entitled to receive an annual retainer of $90,000, which was increased to $130,000 as of April 13, 2016, payable on a quarterly basis, 50% in cash and 50% in shares of our Class A common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Those who serve on our Audit Committee are paid an additional retainer of $25,000 (or $30,000 for the committee Chairman); those who serve on our Compensation Committee are paid an additional retainer of $15,000 (or $20,000 for the committee Chairman); and those who serve on our NCG Committee are paid an additional retainer of $10,000 (or $15,000 for the committee Chairman).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Committee retainers are paid quarterly in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Non-employee directors are also reimbursed for incidental expenses associated with each Board of Directors and/or committee meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Lead Director receives an additional $75,000 per year for his services in that capacity, paid quarterly in cash.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Directors who are employees do not receive any additional compensation for their services as a director.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Deferral.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: A director may elect to defer payment of both the cash and stock portion of the annual and committee retainers until the year of the members separation from service as a director or the members death.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If a director makes this election, a number of phantom shares of Class A common stock with a value equal to the amount of the deferred retainers is credited to the directors deferred compensation account each quarter.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Amounts equal to the dividends that would have been paid if the phantom shares had actually been outstanding are also credited to the directors account and treated as though they were used to purchase additional shares of Class A common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Upon termination of a directors deferred compensation account, the director will receive cash equal to the value of the number of phantom shares of Class A common stock or Class B common stock credited to the directors account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The value of the phantom shares of Class A common stock and Class B common stock is determined by multiplying the phantom shares by the closing price of the applicable common stock on either the date of the directors death or the date during the year of the directors separation from service that the director sends a notice to the Company requesting the settlement of such directors phantom share account.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN
