sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: III.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: COMPENSATION DISCUSSION AND ANALYSIS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This Compensation Discussion and Analysis describes our compensation philosophy, policies and plans and their objectives, our compensation-setting process, and the 2016 compensation of our named executive officers, or NEOs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, we explain why we believe that our executive compensation plan is in the best interests of you, our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For fiscal 2016, our named executive officers were:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Chief Executive Officer President Vice President and Chief Operating Officer Vice President and Chief Financial Officer Secretary and General Counsel
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As discussed in Proposal 3 on page 43, we are conducting a Say on Pay vote that requests your approval, on an advisory basis, of the compensation of our named executive officers as described in this section and in the tables and accompanying narrative contained in the discussion captioned Executive Compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with that vote, you should review our compensation philosophies, the design of our executive compensation programs and how, we believe, these programs have contributed to the strong financial performance that Lennar has provided to stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Summary
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We Tie Our Executives Compensation to Performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that one of the best methods for aligning the interests of our senior executives with those of our stockholders is to tie a significant portion of their compensation to our financial and operational performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to our three named executive officers whose responsibilities are to grow our business, our CEO, our President and our COO, this translates into:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: tied directly to the financial performance of the Company;  Annual incentive awards of our CEO, our President and our COO are a percentage of pretax income  the metric that we believe most directly translates into stockholder value; and  Equity awards are earned only if the Company accomplishes financial and operational metrics, which we
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to our other two named executive officers, our CFO and our General Counsel, whose principal responsibilities are the establishment and maintenance of strong corporate controls and regulatory compliance, we base their annual cash incentive award targets on their individual performance, the performance of the Company in its adherence to corporate governance, policies and procedures, the results of an annual internal audit evaluation and, in the case of our CFO, the pretax income of our Lennar Financial Services segment, which he oversees.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The bonus each executive is awarded is based on the extent to which the executive achieves his target and the Companys financial performance, measured by our pretax income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity awards are service-based and vest over three years with respect to our CFO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to our General Counsel, equity awards are earned only if the Company accomplishes certain financial and operational metrics and, upon being earned, the awards vest in three equal annual installments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As a result, 87% of our CFOs total direct compensation and 79% of our General Counsels total direct compensation for 2016 was performance or equity based.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We Maintain Strong Executive Compensation Policies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We maintain strong executive compensation policies o further align our executives interests with those of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Specifically, we have:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Stock ownership guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have a minimum stock ownership requirement for all of our executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: All of the NEOs significantly exceed their minimum stock ownership requirements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: No employment agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not have employment agreements, severance agreements, or change of control agreements with any of our executive officers and all equity grants are subject to a double trigger requirement to accelerate vesting in connection with a change of control.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: 2016 Compensation Reflects Exceptional 2016 Company Performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal 2016, we achieved exceptional financial and operational performance, including:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Net earnings of $911.8 million  up 14%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenues of $10.9 billion  up 16%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Deliveries of 26,563 homes  up 9%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: New orders of 27,372 homes  up 9%
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Revenues from home sales increased 15% in the year ended November 30, 2016 to $9.6 billion from the prior fiscal year and gross margins on home sales were $2.2 billion or 23.0% in the year ended November 30, 2016.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal 2016, we also had strong performances from our other business segments.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Lennar Financial Services segment had operating earnings of $163.6 million.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Multifamily business had operating earnings of $71.2 million in fiscal 2016, benefiting from the sale of seven completed rental properties.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the year ended November 30, 2016, the Multifamily venture received an additional $1.1 billion of equity commitments completing the fund raising for the venture and increasing its total commitments to $2.2 billion, including a $504 million co-investment commitment by Lennar.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Finally, in fiscal 2016, we contributed, or obtained the right to contribute, our investment in three strategic joint ventures previously managed by FivePoint Communities in exchange for an investment in a FivePoint entity.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Setting Process
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We designed our executive compensation to:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: attract, motivate and retain highly qualified and experienced executives;   recognize valuable individual performance and motivate executives to maximize the Companys short-term and long-term performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: maintain flexibility to ensure that awards are competitive within our peer group of homebuilders and Fortune 500 companies;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: align the interests of our executives with those of our stockholders; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: promote adherence to corporate governance, and company policies and values.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of the Compensation Committee
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Compensation Committee annually evaluates and approves the compensation for our CEO and our most senior executive officers, including all the named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Its determinations regarding the compensation of our senior executive officers take into account information about compensation being paid by other homebuilders or companies engaged in other activities of the type in which we are engaged, as well as recommendations by our CEO and President (except regarding themselves) and other members of our senior management, and any other factors the Compensation Committee believes to be applicable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of the Independent Compensation Consultant
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee has the authority to engage compensation consultants.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During fiscal 2016, the Compensation Committee engaged F.W. Cook & Co., Inc., an independent management compensation consulting firm, to perform a review of the Companys non-employee director compensation program.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee considered the work previously performed by FW Cook and determined that no conflicts of interest were raised and that FW Cook was independent from management.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Role of Management
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO and our President provide written background and supporting materials for review at Compensation Committee meetings, attend Compensation Committee meetings at the Committees request, and provide information regarding, and make recommendations about, designs for and, if warranted, changes to our executive compensation programs.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CEO and our President provide reviews of each executive officers performance and recommend compensation actions for executive officers other than themselves.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Use of Compensation Survey Data
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We use compensation data regarding what we view as our peer group of publicly-traded homebuilding companies to analyze compensation decisions in light of current market rates and practices, and to help ensure that our compensation decisions are reasonable in comparison to the compensation paid by our peer group and in view of the value of particular executives to Lennar.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with setting fiscal 2016 compensation, the Compensation Committee reviewed summaries of information disclosed in public filings by the following publicly traded homebuilders that the Compensation Committee views as our peer group (Peer Group), based on revenue and home closings:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Beazer Homes USA, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: CalAtlantic Group, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Century Communities, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: D.R. Horton, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Hovnanian Enterprises, Inc.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: KB Home
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In addition, the Compensation Committee reviewed information about compensation levels generally paid by Fortune 500 companies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee does not design our executive compensation programs to fit within a specific percentile of the executive compensation programs of the Peer Group companies, the Fortune 500 companies or any other peer group or survey.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Rather, the Compensation Committee compares numerous elements of executive compensation, including base salaries, annual incentive compensation and long-term cash and equity based incentives to assist in determining whether proposed compensation programs are competitive, and then uses its experience and judgment to make final compensation decisions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Consideration of Stockholder Advisory Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its compensation setting process, the Compensation Committee also considers the results of the prior- years stockholder advisory vote on our executive compensation to provide useful feedback.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: As part of its 2016 compensation setting process, the Compensation Committee reviewed the results of the 2016 stockholder advisory vote, including the fact that approximately 93% of the votes cast were voted in favor of our executive compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee intends to annually review the results of the
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: advisory vote and will be cognizant of this feedback as it completes its annual review of the compensation packages for our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compensation Plans
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2016 Equity Plan provides for the issuance of stock-based awards, such as options and restricted stock, to officers, directors, or associates of the Company and its subsidiaries, or individuals who provide significant services to the Company or its subsidiaries.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The aggregate number of shares of Class A common stock or Class B common stock that may be subject to awards granted under the 2016 Equity Plan is 15 million shares.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 Equity Plan replaced our prior equity plan, the 2007 Equity Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: While awards may no longer be issued under the 2007 Equity Plan, the 2007 Equity Plan still governs the outstanding awards that were issued under the 2007 Equity Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our 2012 Incentive Compensation Plan and 2016 Incentive Compensation Plan enable the Compensation Committee to establish performance goals for officers and other associates of the Company and its subsidiaries to determine bonuses which will be awarded on the basis of such performance goals.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In April 2016, our 2016 Incentive Compensation Plan replaced our 2012 Incentive Compensation Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive Compensation Components and 2016 Compensation Decisions
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers do not have employment agreements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This gives the Compensation Committee flexibility to change the components of our executive compensation program in order to remain competitive in the market and address economic conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive compensation program currently has three components of total direct compensation: (1) base salary, (2) annual cash incentive awards, and (3) equity-based incentive awards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Element   Description   Primary Objectives Base Salary    Fixed cash payment    To attract and retain executives by offering salaries that are competitive with market opportunities and that recognize each executives position, role, responsibility and experience.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Annual Cash Incentive Award    Variable performance-based cash payment    To motivate and reward the achievement of annual financial performance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Equity-Based Incentive Award    Performance-based restricted stock, with respect to our CEO, our President, our COO and our General Counsel.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Service-based restricted stock with respect to our CFO.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: To align executives interests with the interests of stockholders, motivate executives to maximize our long-term, as well as our short-term, performance and promote employee retention.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We do not have a formal policy relating to the allocation of total compensation among the various components.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, our Compensation Committee believes executives with more influence over our operating and financial performance should have a greater portion of their compensation dependent upon the achievement of the performance objectives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that those executives who are responsible for growth should have the largest portion of their compensation from
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Why we pay equity-based compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committees philosophy is that a significant component of a senior executives compensation should be long-term incentive compensation in the form of restricted stock so as to align the financial interests of our senior executives with those of our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2009, we have provided long-term equity incentive awards solely in the form of restricted stock, both performance-based and service- based.

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee believes that giving equity incentives to our senior executives in the form of restricted stock also:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: motivates our senior management to maximize our long term, as well as our short term, performance;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: helps us attract and motivate highly qualified and experienced executives; and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During 2016, our Compensation Committee reviewed the effect that our restricted stock grant program had on our retention of our senior executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Committee decided that the program had provided, and continued to provide, a strong retention incentive for senior management and that, because of the stacking effect, a program of annual grants that vests in three annual installments provides better employee retention benefits than a grant that vests upon the grant date.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Compensation Committee also believes that restricted stock awards provide a strong retention incentive for other key associates.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In 2016, the Compensation Committee decided that we should continue making grants of restricted stock to a wider group of key associates, and, with the approval of the Compensation Committee, in June 2016, the Company awarded grants of restricted stock to senior management, our Division Presidents, our key Regional managers and other key associates (270 persons).

sentences.text: Executive and Director Stock Ownership Guidelines.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our Board has adopted Stock Ownership Guidelines establishing minimum equity ownership requirements for our executive officers and each member of our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The purposes of the guidelines are to align the interests of those executives and directors with the interests of stockholders and further promote our commitment to sound corporate governance.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Under those guidelines, a person is expected to own, by a date not later than five years after the person is elected as a director or is appointed to his or her position as an executive officer, shares of our common stock with a value on that date equal to the following multiple of the persons annual directors fee or annual base salary:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Position        Base Salary/Fee Multiple Requirement Director      5x Chief Executive Officer      6x President      5x Chief Operating Officer      5x Chief Financial Officer      3x Treasurer      2x General Counsel/ Secretary      2x Controller      2x
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Until the required stock ownership level is achieved, a person is required to retain at least 50% of the restricted shares that become vested and the shares the person acquires through exercise of stock options, other than shares sold to enable the person to pay taxes resulting from the vesting or exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the required level is not achieved within five years after a person is elected as a Director or appointed to his or her position as an executive officer, until the required level is achieved, the person will be required to retain 100% of the restricted shares that become vested and the shares the person acquires through exercise of stock options, other than shares sold to enable the person to pay taxes resulting from the vesting or exercise.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Compliance with Internal Revenue Code Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: When reviewing and setting compensation awards for our executives, one of the things we consider is the potential effect of Section 162(m) of the Internal Revenue Code on the tax deductibility of their compensation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 162(m) generally does not allow a publicly-held company to deduct compensation over $1 million paid for any fiscal year to any of the executive officers required to be named in the companys annual proxy statement, except for the chief financial officer.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, Section 162(m) allows deduction of qualified performance-based compensation if certain requirements are met.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We generally have structured awards to our executive officers in ways that are intended to qualify for the performance-based compensation exemption under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, we can exercise judgment and may award compensation that does not qualify for tax deductibility under Section 162(m).
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Each of our 2007 Equity Plan, our 2016 Equity Plan, our 2012 Incentive Compensation Plan and our 2016 Incentive Compensation Plan includes lists of possible criteria that may be used as the basis for performance requirements with regard to compensation awards.

sentences.text: The definitions of Change in Control, Cause and Good Reason pursuant to the 2016 Equity Plan are below, and are substantially similar to the same definitions in the 2007 Equity Plan.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Change in Control means
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a sale, lease, exchange or other transfer (in one transaction or a series of related transactions) of all or substantially all of our assets to any person or group of related persons (as that term is defined for purposes of Section 13(d) of the Exchange Act) (a Group), other than a transaction with a majority owned subsidiary of ours or a transaction in which the common stock that is outstanding immediately before the transaction constitutes, or entitles the holders to receive, a majority of the shares of the purchaser that are outstanding immediately after the transaction;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the approval by the holders of our capital stock of any plan or proposal for the liquidation or dissolution of the Company;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) the acquisition by any person or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: group (other than one or more of the wife, or lineal descendants of the late Leonard Miller, or trusts or entities of which they own a majority of the beneficial interests) of beneficial ownership (determined as provided in the rules under Section 13 of the Exchange Act) of more than 50% in voting power of the outstanding common stock; or (iv) a majority of the members of the Board being persons who were not Directors on the effective date of the plan and whose election was not approved by a vote of at least a majority of the members of the Board of Directors who either were members of the Board on the effective date of the plan or whose election, or nomination for election, to the Board was approved by such a majority.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Cause means, unless otherwise provided in the participants award agreement, the participants:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) engaging in (A) willful or gross misconduct or (B) willful or gross neglect;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) repeatedly failing to adhere to the directions of superiors or the Board or the written policies and practices of the Company or its subsidiaries or its affiliates;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) commission of a felony or a crime of moral turpitude, dishonesty, breach of trust or unethical business conduct, or any crime involving the Company or its subsidiaries, or any affiliate thereof;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) fraud, misappropriation or embezzlement;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) material breach of the participants employment agreement (if any) with the Company or its subsidiaries or its affiliates;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vi) acts or omissions constituting a material failure to perform substantially and adequately the duties assigned to the participant;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (vii) illegal act detrimental to the Company or its subsidiaries or its affiliates;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (viii) repeated failure to devote substantially all of the participants business time and efforts to the Company if required by the terms of the participants employment; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ix) violation of any rule or policy of the Company that states that violations may result in termination of employment; provided, however, that, if at any particular time the participant is subject to an effective employment agreement with the Company, then, in lieu of the foregoing definition, Cause shall at that time have such meaning with respect to the participant as may be specified in such employment agreement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Good Reason means, with respect to a participant who is an employee of the Company or one or more of its subsidiaries,
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) a reduction in the participants base salary (other than a reduction of not greater than 10% that applies to all executives of a comparable level);
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) a reduction in the participants target cash annual incentive opportunity;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iii) a material reduction in the aggregate value of the participants benefits under the employee benefit plans, programs and policies in which the participant participates;
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (iv) a material diminution in the participants reporting relationship, title or responsibilities; or
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (v) a requirement by the Company or its subsidiary to which the participant does not consent that the participant move the principal place of business at or from which the participant works by more than 50 miles, if such relocation results in an increase in the participants daily commute by more than 10 miles each way.

sentences.text: V. PROPOSAL 2  RATIFICATION OF INDEPENDENT REGISTERED PUBLIC ACCOUNTANTS
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee of the Board of Directors has appointed D&T to continue to serve as our independent registered public accounting firm for the fiscal year ending November 30, 2017 and the Board has directed that management submit the selection of D&T as Lennars independent registered public accounting firm for ratification by the stockholders at the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: D&T has been Lennars independent public accounting firm since 1994.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Neither Lennars By-Laws nor any other governing documents or law require stockholder ratification of the selection of Lennars independent registered public accounting firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: However, the Board is submitting the selection of D&T to the stockholders for ratification as a matter of what it believes to be good corporate practice.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: If the stockholders fail to ratify the selection, the Audit Committee will reconsider whether to retain that firm.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Even if the selection is ratified, the Audit Committee in its discretion may direct the appointment of a different independent registered public accounting firm at any time during the year if it determines that such a change would be in the best interests of Lennar and its stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We expect a representative of D&T to attend the Annual Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The representative will have an opportunity to make a statement if he or she desires and also will be available to respond to appropriate questions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Audit Committee Report
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Management has the primary responsibility for producing the Companys financial statements and for implementing the Companys financial reporting process, including the Companys system of internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent registered public accounting firm is responsible for performing an independent audit of the Companys financial statements in accordance with the standards of the Public Company Accounting Oversight Board (United States) (PCAOB) and issuing a report thereon.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committees responsibilities include assisting the Board of Directors in its oversight of the Companys financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In fulfilling its responsibilities, the Audit Committee reviewed the Companys audited financial statements for the year ended November 30, 2016 with management, including a discussion of the quality, not just the acceptability, of accounting principles, the reasonableness of significant judgments and the clarity of disclosures in the financial statements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: During the course of fiscal 2016, management undertook the testing and evaluation of the Companys system of internal control over financial reporting in response to the requirements set forth in Section 404 of the Sarbanes-Oxley Act and related regulations.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee was kept apprised of the progress of the evaluation and provided oversight and advice to management during the process.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: In connection with this oversight, the Audit Committee received periodic updates provided by management and Deloitte & Touche LLP at each Audit Committee meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the conclusion of the process, the Audit Committee reviewed the report of management contained in the Companys Annual Report on Form 10-K for the fiscal year ended November 30, 2016 that has been filed with the SEC, as well as Deloitte & Touche LLPs Reports of Independent Registered Public Accounting Firm included in the Companys Annual Report on Form 10-K related to its audits of:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (i) the consolidated financial statements and schedule thereto and
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: (ii) the effectiveness of internal control over financial reporting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee continues to oversee the Companys efforts related to its internal control over financial reporting and managements preparations for the evaluation in fiscal 2017.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has discussed with the Companys independent registered public accounting firm the matters required to be discussed by PCAOB Auditing Standard No.16, Communication with Audit Committees, and Rule 2-07 of SEC Regulation S-X.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has received and reviewed the written disclosures and the letter from the independent registered public accounting firm required by the PCAOB Ethics and Independence Rule 3526, Communication with Audit Committee Concerning Independence, and has discussed with Deloitte & Touche LLP the firms independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has also considered whether the providing of audit-related and other non-audit services by Deloitte to the Company is compatible with maintaining the firms independence.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has evaluated the independent registered public accounting firms role in performing an independent audit of the Companys financial statements in accordance with the standards of the PCAOB and applicable professional and firm auditing standards, including quality control standards.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Audit Committee has received assurances from the independent registered public accounting firm that the audit was subject to its quality control system for its accounting and auditing practice in the United States.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The independent registered public accounting firm has further assured the Audit Committee that its engagement was conducted in compliance with professional standards and that there was appropriate continuity of personnel working on the audit and availability of national office consultation to conduct the relevant portions of the audit.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the reviews and discussions referred to above, the Audit Committee recommended to the Board of Directors and the Companys management that the audited financial statements be included in the Annual Report on Form 10-K for the Companys fiscal year ended November 30, 2016 that was filed with the Securities and Exchange Commission.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: By recommending to the Board of Directors and the Companys management that the audited financial statements be so included, the Audit Committee was not opining on the accuracy, completeness or presentation of the information contained in the audited financial statements.

sentences.text: VI.

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 3  ADVISORY VOTE ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 14A of the Exchange Act, which was added by the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act of 2010, requires us to provide our stockholders with the opportunity to approve, on a non-binding, advisory basis, the compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We provide our stockholders with the opportunity to cast an annual advisory vote on the compensation of our named executive officers as disclosed above in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the compensation tables and the narrative disclosures that accompany those tables.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At our 2016 annual meeting, approximately 93% of the votes cast supported the Say on Pay proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: At the 2017 Annual Meeting, we are asking our stockholders to approve, on an advisory basis, the 2016 compensation of our named executive officers as disclosed in this proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We encourage stockholders to review the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the compensation tables and the related narrative disclosures on pages 19 to 38.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that the success of our Company is attributable in substantial part to our talented and committed executives.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Therefore, the compensation of our NEOs is designed to enable us to retain, motivate and recruit high-quality, experienced executives who can help us achieve our short- and long-term corporate goals and strategies.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that our executive compensation program strikes the appropriate balance between utilizing responsible, measured pay practices and effectively incentivizing our executives to dedicate themselves fully to value creation for our stockholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This balance is evidenced by the following:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to our three named executive officers whose responsibilities are to grow our business, our CEO, our President and our COO, approximately 95% of their 2016 total direct compensation (base salary, annual cash incentive awards, and equity-based incentive award) was variable and tied directly to the financial performance of the Company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: With respect to our other two named executive officers, our CFO and our General Counsel, whose principal responsibilities are the establishment and maintenance of strong corporate controls and regulatory compliance, we based their 2016 annual cash incentive awards on their individual performance, the performance of the Company in its adherence to corporate governance, policies and procedures and the results of an annual internal audit evaluation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CFO and our General Counsel were entitled to an additional cash bonus of up to 50% of their target awards based on our actual Pretax Income as compared with our forecasted Pretax Income.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our CFO also receives a bonus based on the pretax income of our Lennar Financial Services segment.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: For all of our NEOs, we provide a balance of short-term and long-term compensation: our annual cash incentive bonus rewards the accomplishment of annual goals, while our equity grants focus our executives financial interests on the long-term appreciation of our Class A common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: n addition, we maintain strong corporate governance practices regarding executive compensation:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Our executive officers do not have employment agreements, which gives the Compensation Committee the flexibility to change the components of our executive compensation program based on market and economic conditions.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have adopted stock ownership guidelines that promote continued alignment of our executives interests with those of our stockholders and discourage excessive risk taking to achieve short-term gains.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: On the basis of the information in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the compensation tables and the related narrative disclosure on pages 19 to 38 of this proxy statement, we are requesting that our stockholders vote on the following resolution:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the stockholders of Lennar Corporation approve, on a non-binding, advisory basis, the compensation of Lennars named executive officers, as described in the Compensation Discussion and Analysis, the tabular disclosures regarding such compensation, and the accompanying narrative disclosures, set forth in Lennars 2017 Annual Meeting proxy statement.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Although this Say on Pay vote on executive compensation is non-binding, the Board and the Compensation Committee will review the results of the vote and will take into account the outcome of the vote when determining future executive compensation arrangements.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote FOR adoption of the resolution approving the compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Table of Contents
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: VII.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 4  ADVISORY VOTE ON FREQUENCY OF VOTE ON EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 14A of the Exchange Act, which was added by the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act of 2010, requires us to provide our stockholders with the opportunity to vote, on a non-binding, advisory basis, on whether the advisory vote on executive compensation should occur every one year, two years or three years.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: You have the option to vote for any of the three options, or to abstain from casting a vote.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board believes that a frequency of every one year for the vote on executive compensation is the best approach for Lennar.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Since 2011, Lennar has been providing its stockholders with the opportunity to cast an annual advisory vote on the compensation of our named executive officers.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We believe that an annual vote cycle allows stockholders to provide, on a regular basis, input on our compensation program design.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The vote that is the subject of this Proposal will not be binding upon us or upon our Board.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Accordingly, even if a majority of the votes cast by our stockholders are cast in favor of having votes on executive officer compensation be less frequent than every one year, our Board will not necessarily cause us to reduce the frequency of those votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Nonetheless, if the vote on how frequently the stockholders should vote on executive compensation indicates a clear stockholder preference for voting less frequently than every one year, the Board would consider that in deciding whether to change its decision to have a vote on executive officer compensation every one year.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED, that the stockholders of Lennar determine, on a non-binding, advisory basis, that the frequency with which the stockholders of Lennar shall have a non-binding, advisory vote on the compensation of Lennars named executive officers should be:
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Choice 1 - every three years; Choice 2 - every two years; Choice 3 - every one year; or Choice 4 - abstain from voting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote FOR having an advisory vote on executive compensation every one
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: VIII.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: PROPOSAL 5  GIVE EACH SHARE AN EQUAL VOTE
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have received the following stockholder proposal from John Chevedden, 2215 Nelson Avenue, No. 205, Redondo Beach, CA 90278.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Mr. Chevedden has represented that he will meet SEC Rule 14a-8 requirements, including the requirement that he will continually own the required market value of our stock until after the date of the Meeting.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: We have copied the text of the proposal (including title and stockholder-supplied emphasis) and the stockholders supporting statement as it was provided to us by the stockholder.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Following the proposal we provide the Boards recommendation to vote AGAINST the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Proposal 5  Give Each Share An Equal Vote
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: RESOLVED: Shareholders request that our Board take steps to ensure that all of our companys outstanding stock has one-vote per share in each voting situation.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This would encompass all practicable steps including encouragement and negotiation with shareholders, who have more than one vote per share, to request that they relinquish, for the common good of all shareholders, any preexisting rights, if necessary.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proposal is not intended to unnecessarily limit our Boards judgment in crafting the requested change in accordance with applicable laws and existing contracts.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This proposal is important because certain shares have super-sized voting power with 10-votes per share compared to one-vote per share for other shareholders.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Without an equal voice, shareholders cannot hold management accountable.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The 2016 edition of this proposal topic won 158 million yes-votes at our company.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Also, the 2016 proposal on this topic, submitted to Ford Motor, won the all-time highest support for any Ford shareholder proposal1.7 Billion yes-votes.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Please vote to protect shareholder value: Give Each Share An Equal Vote  Proposal 5
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Boards Statement in Opposition to Stockholder Proposal
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board opposes the proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The only difference between our two classes of common stock is that the Class A common stock has one vote per share while the Class B common stock has ten votes per share.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: This dual class voting structure has twice been approved by our stockholdersonce in 1987 when they initially authorized us to issue multiple voting Class B common stock, and again in 2003 when they approved an increase in the number of shares of Class B common stock we could issue and changes to the terms of the Class B common stock that enabled it to be listed on the New York Stock Exchange.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board originally believed this voting structure had value, and our Board continues to believe this voting structure benefits Lennar.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Recommendation of the Board of Directors
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: The Board of Directors recommends a vote AGAINST this proposal.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) Beneficial Ownership Reporting Compliance
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Section 16(a) of the Exchange Act requires our directors and executive officers, and persons who own more than 10% of a registered class of our equity securities, to file with the SEC and the NYSE reports of ownership and changes in ownership of our Class A common stock and Class B common stock.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Executive officers, directors and greater than 10% stockholders are required by SEC regulation to furnish us with copies of all Section 16(a) forms they file.
sentences.label: UNKNOWN

sentences.text: Based on the review of copies of such reports furnished to us and written representations by our directors and officers that no other reports by them were required, we believe that, during the 2016 fiscal year, our executive officers, directors and greater than 10% beneficial owners complied with all Section 16(a) filing requirements applicable to them, except that due to administrative error, Mr. Bolotins Section 16 reports did not timely report the sale to Mr. Bolotins daughters for estate planning purposes of interests in a limited partnership owned by Mr. Bolotin that holds 63,274 shares of Class A common stock and 11,954 shares of Class B common stock.
